View.description: This is your root View. It requires exactly one child widget of type Column, Row, Flex, or Stack.

title.description: A simple text or a custom widget for the App's title

flexibleBackground.description: This widget (typically used as an background image) acts as the header's background, with the title bar and the bottom widget overlaid on top. On non-scrollable screen, its dimensions is dictated by the header's width and height.

backgroundColor.description: By default the background color uses the theme's 'primary' color. You can override the header's background color here.

color.description: By default the navigation icon, title, and action icons uses the theme's 'onPrimary' color. You can override their colors here.

elevation.description: Raise the header on its z-coordinates relative to the body. This effectively creates a drop shadow on the header's bottom edge.

shadowColor.description: If elevation is non-zero, this will override the drop shadow color of the header's bottom edge.

showNavigationIcon.description: By default the App automatically injects the Menu or Back icon (if applicable) before the title. You may hide these icons by setting this to false.

centerTitle.description: Whether to align the title in the title bar's center horizontally (default: true)

titleBarHeight.description: For consistency, the header's title bar has the default fixed height of 56 regardless of its content. You may adjust its height here.

flexibleMinHeight.description: Applicable only if scrollableView is enabled. This attribute effectively sets the header's min height on scrolling (header's height will varies between the flexibleMinHeight and flexibleMaxHeight). Note that this attribute will be ignored if smaller than the titleBarHeight

flexibleMaxHeight.description: Applicable only if scrollableView is enabled. This attribute effectively sets the header's max height on scrolling (header's height will varies between the flexibleMinHeight and flexibleMaxHeight). This attribute will be ignored if smaller than the flexibleMinHeight

onLoad.description: Execute an Action when the page loads

type.description: Specify if this is a regular (default) or modal page

closeButtonPosition.description: For modal page, position the close button at the start or end of the screen. For left-to-right languages like English, start is on the left and end is on the right.

useSafeArea.description: Applicable only when we don't have a header. If true, insert paddings around the body content to account for the the devices' Safe Area (e.g. iPhone notch). Default is false.

scrollableView.description: Specify if the content of this page is scrollable with a global scrollbar. Using this also allow us to customize the scrolling experience of the header.

backgroundColor.description: Background color for the page starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

Functions.description: Javascript snippet for declaring variables and reusable functions, visible anywhere within this page

defaultSnippets.label: Define variables and functions in Javascript

inputs.description: Define the list of input names that this API accepts

parameters.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass along with the URL

body.description: The request body to pass along with the URL

inputs.description: Define the list of input names that this Custom Widget accepts.

onLoad.description: Execute an Action when this Custom Widget loads

font.description: Default built-in style for this text

overflow.description: Set treatment of text longer than available space

textStyle.description: Styling for regular text. Default to theme's bodyMedium styling

icon.description: Icon name from Material Icons or Font Awesome

onTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

source.description: URL to or asset name of the image

fit.description: How to fit the image within our width/height or our parent (if dimension is not specified)

oneOf.description: Stretch our image to fill the dimension, and distorting the aspect ratio if needed
Scale the image such that the entire image is contained within our dimension
Scale the image to fill our dimension, clipping the image as needed
Scale the image to fit the width, and clipping the height if needed
Scale the image to fit the height, and clipping the width if needed
Center-Align the original image size, clipping the content if needed
Center-Align the image and only scale down to fit. Image will not be scaled up to bigger dimension.

source.description: URL or asset name of the Lottie json file

repeat.description: Whether we should repeat the animation (default true)

fit.description: How to fit the Lottie animation within our width/height or our parent (if dimension is not specified)

oneOf.description: Stretch our Lottie to fill the dimension, and distorting the aspect ratio if needed
Scale the Lottie such that the entire Lottie is contained within our dimension
Scale the Lottie to fill our dimension, clipping the Lottie as needed
Scale the Lottie to fit the width, and clipping the height if needed
Scale the Lottie to fit the height, and clipping the width if needed
Center-Align the original Lottie size, clipping the content if needed
Center-Align the Lottie and only scale down to fit. Lottie will not be scaled up to bigger dimension.

value.description: The data to generate the QR code

size.description: Specify the width/height of the QR Code. Default: 160

color.description: Set the color for the QR code drawing

countdown.description: Show the progress percentage based on the number of seconds specified here

onCountdownComplete.description: Execute this Action when the countdown comes to 0

size.description: Specifies the width (progress bar) or the diameter (circular progress indicator)

thickness.description: Specifies the thickness of the indicator (for progress bar this is the height)

direction.description: Whether to display a horizontal divider (default) or vertical divider.

color.description: The line color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

indent.description: The leading gap before the line starts

endIndent.description: The ending gap after the line ends

onKeyPress.description: On every keystroke, call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

value.description: Specifying the value of your Text Input

obscureText.description: whether we should obscure the typed-in text (e.g Social Security)

obscureToggle.description: enable the toggling between plain and obscure text.

onKeyPress.description: On every keystroke, call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

obscureToggle.description: enable the toggling between plain and obscure text.

value.description: Select a value that matches one of the items. If Items are Objects, it should match the value key

items.description: List of values, or Objects with value/label pairs

initialValue.description: The highlighted initial date in the calendar picker (default is Today). Use format YYYY-MM-DD.

firstDate.description: The first selectable date in the calendar. Use format YYYY-MM-DD

lastDate.description: The last selectable date in the calendar. Use format YYYY-MM-DD

showCalendarIcon.description: Whether we should show (default) or hide the calendar icon. Selecting the text will still open the calendar picker

initialValue.description: The highlighted initial time in the time picker. Use format HH:MM

submitForm.description: If the button is inside a Form and upon on tap, it will execute the form's onSubmit action if this property is TRUE

onTap.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code

outline.description: Whether the button should have an outline border instead of filled background

backgroundColor.description: Button background color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

color.description: Set the color for the button label starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

onSubmit.description: Action to execute when the form is submitted

labelPosition.description: Where the position the FormField's label

labelOverflow.description: Treatment of text longer than available space

gap.description: Vertical gap to insert between the children (default is 10)

direction.description: The main direction to lay out the children before wrapping

onItemChange.description: Dispatch when an carousel item is in focus. For SingleView, this happens when the item is scroll into view. For scrolling MultiView, the event dispatches only when you tap on the item. The index of the item can be retrieved using 'selectedIndex'.

layout.description: Show a SingleView (on screen one at a time), MultiView (scrolling items), or automatically switch between the views with autoLayoutBreakpoint

autoLayoutBreakpoint.description: Show multiple views on the carousel if the breakpoint is equal or larger than this threshold, otherwise show single view. (default 768)

gap.description: The gap between each views, but also act as a left-right margin in a single view

leadingGap.description: The space before the first item. Note that the left edge of the scroll area is still controlled by padding or margin.

trailingGap.description: The space after the last item. Note that the right edge of the scroll area is still controlled by padding or margin.

singleItemWidthRatio.description: The screen width ratio for each carousel item (in single item mode). Value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 for the full width. (default 1.0)

multipleItemWidthRatio.description: The screen width ratio for each carousel item (in multiple item mode). Value ranges from 0.0 to 1.0 for the full width (default 0.6)

indicatorType.description: How the view indicator should be displayed

indicatorPosition.description: Where to display the indicator if specified

data.description: Bind to an array of data from an API response or a variable

name.description: Set the name to reference as you iterate through the array of data

template.description: The widget to render for each item

icon.description: Icon name from Material Icons or Font Awesome

onChange.description: Call Ensemble's built-in functions or execute code when the input changes. Note for free-form text input, this event only dispatches if the text changes AND the focus is lost (e.g. clicking on button)

keyboardAction.description: Specify the action key on native device's soft keyboard

oneOf.description: show the keyboard action that represents completion (e.g. Android's checkmark, iOS's Done)
show the keyboard action that represents go (e.g. Android's right arrow, iOS's Done)
show the keyboard action that represents search
show the keyboard action that represents send
Move the focus to the next focusable field
Move the focus to the previous focusable field

id.description: Give the API an ID allows you to bind to its result. e.g. ${apiId.body...}

name.description: Enter the name of your defined API

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass to the API

onResponse.description: Execute another Action upon API's successful response

onError.description: Execute an Action when the API completes with error(s)

name.description: Enter the Name or ID of your Screen

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass into the next Screen

name.description: Enter the Name or ID of your screen

inputs.description: Specify the key/value pairs to pass into the next Screen

onModalDismiss.description: Execute an Action when the modal screen is dismissed

name.description: Specifies a widget name or declare a widget to render inside the Dialog

horizontalOffset.description: Offset the dialog's position horizontally, with -1.0 for the screen's left and 1.0 for the screen's right. (default is 0 for centering horizontally)

verticalOffset.description: Offset the dialog's position vertically, with -1.0 for the screen's top and 1.0 for the screen's bottom. (default is 0 for centering vertically)

onDialogDismiss.description: Execute an Action when the Dialog is dismissed

id.description: Stop the timer with this ID if it is running
Give this timer an ID so it can be cancelled by a stopTimer action

isGlobal.description: Marking this timer as global will ensure the timer, if repeating indefinitely, will continue to run even if the user navigates away from the screen, until explicitly stopped by the stopTimer action. Note that there can only ever be one global timer. Creating a new global timer will automatically cancel the previous global timer.

startAfter.description: Delay the timer's start by this number of seconds. If not specified and repeat is true, repeatInterval will be used. If none is specified, there will be no initial delay

repeat.description: Whether the time should repeat and trigger at every repeatInterval seconds. This Timer will run continuously unless a maxNumberOfTimes is specified

repeatInterval.description: Trigger the timer periodically at this repeatInterval (in seconds)

maxNumberOfTimes.description: Set the max number of times the timer will triggers, if repeat is true

onTimer.description: Execute an Action every time the timer triggers

onTimerComplete.description: Execute an Action when the timer has completed and will terminate

body.description: Define your code block here, starting with //@code

onComplete.description: Execute another Action when the code body finishes executing

type.description: Select a built-in toast or a your own custom toast widget

message.description: The toast message (required for non-custom toast type)

dismissible.description: Whether to show a dismiss button (default is True)

duration.description: The number of seconds before the toast is dismissed

shadowColor.description: box shadow color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

recurring.description: Whether to continuously get the device location on this screen. Note that a screen can only have one recurring location listener. Adding multiple recurring location listeners will cancel the previous one.

recurringDistanceFilter.description: If recurring, the minimum distance (in meters) the device has moved before new location is returned. (default: 1000 meters, minimum: 50 meters)

onLocationReceived.description: Callback Action once we get the device location

onError.description: Callback Action if we are unable to get the device location. Reason is available under 'reason' field

Menu.description: Specify the navigation menu for this page

oneOf.description: Use the bottom navigation bar (default)
Put the menu behind a drawer icon on the header
Enable a fixed navigation menu to the left of the screen. Recommend for web only.

backgroundColor.description: Background color for our menu starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

icon.description: Icon name from Material Icons or Font Awesome

page.description: The new page to navigate to on click

selected.description: Mark this item as selected. There should only be one selected item per page.

itemDisplay.description: How to render each navigation item

itemPadding.description: Padding for each navigation item with CSS-style value

minWidth.description: The minimum width for the menu (default 200)

tabPosition.description: How to lay out the Tab labels

oneOf.description: Align the labels to the start of the container and scroll if necessary
Distribute the labels evenly across available container width. Labels will be cut off instead of scrolling

tabPadding.description: Padding for each tab labels with CSS-style value. Default: 0 30 0 0 (right padding only)

tabFontSize.description: Font size for the tab text

tabFontWeight.description: Font weight for the tab text

tabBackgroundColor.description: The background color of the tab's navigation bar

activeTabColor.description: The color of the selected tab's text

inactiveTabColor.description: The color of the un-selected tabs' text

indicatorColor.description: The color of the selected tab's indicator

indicatorThickness.description: The thickness of the selected tab's indicator

selectedIndex.description: Selecting a Tab based on its index order

items.description: Define each of your Tab here

icon.description: The icon for each tab item. (short-hand 'iconName iconLibrary' also supported)

body.description: Add a widget to be rendered as this tab's content

enabled.description: If enabled, this will prompt the user for location access. User location will then be shown on the map

widget.description: The widget to render the user's location
The widget to render each marker

selectedWidget.description: The widget to render a selected marker

selectedWidgetOverlay.description: The widget to render as an overlay at the bottom of the map. Use this to convey more detail info.

source.description: The URL source to the media file

width.description: By default the width will match its parent's available width, but you can set an explicit width here.

height.description: If no height is specified, the web view will stretch its height to fit its content, in which case a scrollable parent is required to scroll the content. You may override this behavior by explicitly set the web view's height here, or uses 'expanded' to fill the available height.

expanded.description: If the parent is a Row or Column, this flag will stretch this widget in the appropriate direction. (e.g stretch horizontally for parent of type Row)

padding.description: Padding with CSS-style value e.g. padding: 5 20 5

margin.description: Margin with CSS-style notation e.g. margin: 5 20 5

properties.description: Border Radius with CSS-like notation (1 to 4 integers)

borderColor.description: Border color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

backgroundColor.description: BackgroundColor starting with '0xFF' for full opacity e.g 0xFFCCCCCC

fontFamily.description: Set the font family applicable for all widgets inside this container

shadowColor.description: Box shadow color starting with '0xFF' for full opacity

gap.description: The gap between the children in the main direction

lineGap.description: The gap between the lines if the children start wrapping

crossAxis.description: Control the horizontal alignment of the children

mainAxisSize.description: Stretch to the max vertically or only fit the vertical space

scrollable.description: Set to true so content can scroll vertically as needed

autoFit.description: Explicitly make the column's width as wide as the largest child, but only if our column's parent does not already assign a width. This attribute is useful for sizing children who don't have a width (e.g Divider)

crossAxis.description: Control the vertical alignment of the children

mainAxisSize.description: Stretch to the max horizontally or only fit the horizontal space

scrollable.description: Set to true so content can scroll horizontally as needed

autoFit.description: Explicitly make the row's height as tall as the largest child, but only if the row's parent does not already assign us a height. This attribute is useful for sizing children who don't have a width (e.g vertical Divider)

direction.description: Lay out the children vertically or horizontally

mainAxis.description: Control how to lay out the children, in the direction specified by the 'direction' attribute

crossAxis.description: Control the alignment of the children on the secondary axis (depending on the 'direction' attribute)

mainAxisSize.description: stretch to the max or only fit the available space of the main axis (depending on the 'direction' attribute)

scrollable.description: Set to true so content can scroll vertically or horizontally as needed

autoFit.description: Explicitly match the width or height to the largest child's size, but only if the parent does not already assign a width or height. This attribute is useful for sizing children who don't have a width or height (e.g Divider)

start.description: The starting position of the gradient

end.description: The ending position of the gradient

Scale the image to fit the height, and clipping the width if needed

regex.description: The Regular Expression the input will need to match

regexError.description: The customized error message to show when the input does not match the provided regex.
